info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 10 at 8:04PM CDT until May 10 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN COCHRAN...NORTHERN TERRY...HOCKLEY AND NORTHEASTERN YOAKUM COUNTIES... At 802 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles west of Sundown to 3 miles northwest of Tokio, moving northeast at 40 mph. At 757 PM, a wind gust to 66 mph was measured at the West Texas Mesonet near Sundown. Extensive blowing dust with near zero visibilities are likely at times along the leading edge of these storms. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Levelland, Sundown, Locketville, Tokio, Meadow, Ropesville and Opdyke West. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
